headline: Stocks to Watch Recap: Apple, Applied Materials, Chevron, Broadcom
summary: ↗️ Apple (AAPL): Shares in the tech giant are trading near their all-time high from last December. Strong demand for new iPhone 17s have pushed Apple stock higher in recent weeks. The shares rose 0.3% Friday.

headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Tesla, Applied Materials, Apple, Plug Power, Wynn Resorts, Rumble, and More
summary: Stocks were mostly higher Friday as investors continued to shrug off the government shutdown.  Tesla  declined 1.4%, extending losses from Thursday’s session when it fell 5.1% after it reported third-quarter deliveries of 497,099 cars, a record for any quarter.  Tesla stock has gained 4.3% this year.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway preps CEO change, Cracker Barrel dumps ad firm
summary: Yahoo Finance's John Hyland tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-B, BRK-A) voted to separate its chairman and CEO roles, allowing Greg Abel to succeed Buffett as CEO next year. Applied Materials (AMAT) stock is under pressure after the company noted it expects to incur a $600 million loss from Chinese sales restrictions. Cracker Barrel (CBRL) has officially ended its professional relationship with the marketing firm behind its controversial and brief logo change. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Applied Materials, Chevron, Cracker Barrel: Trending Tickers
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Applied Materials (AMAT) warning of a $600 million hit to its full-year sales tied to US-China restrictions, a fire breaking out at Chevron's (CVX) oil refinery in Los Angeles, and Crack Barrel Old Country Store (CBRL) cutting ties with the ad firm behind its controversial logo change. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Tesla, Applied Materials, Boeing, Rumble, and More
summary: Stock futures were rising Friday, pointing to fresh record highs, as investors continued to shrug off the government shutdown.  Tesla  was rising 1.2% in premarket trading after falling 5.1% on Thursday even as the electric-vehicle maker reported third-quarter deliveries of 497,099 cars, a record for any quarter.  The stock drop Thursday ended a four-session winning streak.

headline: Stocks to Watch Friday: Applied Materials, Chevron, Broadcom, Nvidia
summary: ↘️ Applied Materials (AMAT): The semiconductor-equipment maker expects a $710 million hit to revenue from new U.S. rules it says will curb its ability to export to China-based customers. Shares fell roughly 4% in premarket trading.
